thread.title: Janet Yellen Testimony, Google Earnings Highlight Thursday
thread.title_full: Janet Yellen Testimony, Google Earnings Highlight Thursday

title: Janet Yellen Testimony, Google Earnings Highlight Thursday
text:
Janet Yellen Testimony, Google Earnings Highlight Thursday By Kurumi Fukushima | 07/15/15 - 08:26 PM EDT Reprint 
NEW YORK ( TheStreet ) -- Federal Reserve chief Janet Yellen's second day of testimony on Capitol Hill, this time before a Senate panel, will be in focus Thursday. 
In her semiannual testimony to the U.S. House Financial Services Committee, Yellen said the central bank is on track to raise interest rates this year, with the first hike "likely" to come in September. 
On the earnings front, it's another busy day with Citigroup ( C - Get Report ) , Goldman Sachs ( GS - Get Report ) , Blackstone Group ( BX - Get Report ) and eBay ( EBAY - Get Report ) before the opening bell. In the afternoon, look to earnings reports from Google ( GOOGL - Get Report ) and Schlumberger ( SLB ) after the market closes. 
For eBay, the report comes ahead of the split from its payments arm PayPal, after which both will be publicly traded companies. Google is expected to earn $6.70 per share on revenue of $17.75 billion for the period, according to analysts polled by Thomson Reuters . In the same quarter of last year, Google earned $6.08 per share on revenue of $15.96 billion. 
Investors will hear from the company's new CFO Ruth Porat for the first time during the earnings call. Porat, who took over in May, may signal any change in the company's direction and will likely focus on the expenses, according to Bloomberg . 
On the economic calendar are weekly jobless claims, the Philadelphia Fed's business outlook survey and the housing market index. Check Out Our Best Services for Investors 
Portfolio Manager Jim Cramer and Director of Research Jack Mohr reveal their investment tactics while giving advanced notice before every trade. Product Features:
